captions.text:
Washington D.C. is situated on the east coast
of the USA,
along the banks of the Potomac River.

The city has an area of just under 70 square
miles, but it sure packs a lot in!

Washington was founded as the nation's capital
in 1791.

As soon as you land here you get a sense of
the power and history
that this metropolis represents.

Most visitors start at the National Mall,
a two-mile green strip
often referred to as "The Nation's Front Lawn".

Clearly there's no shopping to be done at
this Mall.

What it does offer is a sweep of the country's
most famous monuments and museums,
all in one place.
Begin your tour of the Mall at the Zero Milestone,

the proposed reference point for distances
on all US maps.

To the north you'll see America's most famous
residence, The White House.
To the south stands the Washington Monument.

Rising 555 feet, this marble obelisk is the
centerpiece of the National Mall.

The US Capitol Building, on top of Capitol
Hill,
is the nation's seat of federal government.
Rest a while by the Reflecting Pool.

Surrounded by America's most iconic tributes
to its heroes and founding fathers,

it's easy to let your mind wander back through
the various chapters of America's history.

Nestled in the trees is the Vietnam Veterans
Memorial.

Engraved in its walls are the names of tens
of thousands of soldiers

who lost their lives in the battlefields of
Vietnam.

The nearby Lincoln Memorial is where Martin
Luther King Jr.
made his famous 'I Have A Dream' speech.
Admire the many sculptures and waterfalls

at the Franklin Delano Roosevelt Memorial
further along the Mall.
Across the Tidal Basin,

Thomas Jefferson keeps a watchful eye on the
White House from his own memorial,
built in the style of ancient Rome.

The Mall is also home to many of the nation's
Smithsonian buildings.

To learn more about this interesting collection
of museums and galleries,

stop by at the Information Center in the Smithsonian
Institution Building
called the Castle.

The whole family will enjoy the Smithsonian
National Air and Space Museum,

where you can let your imagination fly high
among historic airplanes and spacecraft.
Create your own headlines at the Newseum,

an interactive museum dedicated to the world
of news media.

The Botanic Garden of the Capitol Building
offers an escape from monuments and museums.

But the Mall is not the only attraction in
D.C..

To explore the many attractions outside of
the Mall,

the convenient Capital Bikeshare system is
available all over the city.

In picture-perfect downtown neighborhoods
such as DuPont Circle,

browse bookstores by day and try the cafés
by night.
Another charming central suburb is Foggy Bottom,

named after the fog that rises from the Potomac
River.

Here you'll find the Watergate Hotel and the
Kennedy Center.
Pass Washington Circle to get to Georgetown.

With its eighteenth-century buildings, it
is the oldest district in D.C.,

and today university students give it a lively
atmosphere.

Wisconsin Avenue and M Street offer many boutique
stores and galleries.
North from here is the National Cathedral,

one of the largest churches in the United
States.
In the nearby Smithsonian National Zoo,

the residents are sure to delight monument-weary
children.

Another family favorite is the International
Spy Museum.

Play undercover agent in an interactive game
where nothing is as it seems!

Just across the river in neighboring Virginia
is the nation's most hallowed ground,
Arlington National Cemetery.

Wander among rows of tombstones dedicated
to those

who made the ultimate sacrifice for their
country.

President John F. Kennedy's final resting
place, marked by an 'eternal' flame,
is one of the most visited graves.

From Arlington House you can look back over
D.C. and its surrounding suburbs.

Washington has a lot more to offer than the
political buildings and stately monuments
that it is so famous for.

And no matter how often you've seen these
landmarks in the news or in movies,

nothing beats 
the real thing!

title: Washington D.C. Vacation Travel Guide | Expedia

comments.author: comedeyzone

comments.text:
I'm a New Yorker, but I've been to DC many times:

The World War II Memorial is awesome

The Smithsonian Air and Space Museum is probably the most popular 
Smithsonian museum (and it does get crowded on weekends and holidays)

I haven't been to the Botanic Garden, but I've heard great things about it. 
During the Christmas holiday, they have a model train show

I haven't been to the Newseum. Note that it is NOT a Smithsonian Museum and 
it cost money to get in (ditto for the  International Spy Museum)

Skip Georgetown. There's nothing that stands out about it and it's a 20 
minute walk from the nearest Metro station (Foggy Bottom/GWU)

The Zoo is cool. I've been there once. The famous panda spends most of the 
day sleeping and generally comes out only in the morning. If you're taking 
the Metro to the Zoo, take it to Cleveland Park and walk downhill

There are a bunch of shops and restaurants at Union Station, Pentagon City 
Mall, and Tysons Corner Mall.

The DC Metro is generally reliable (though it has its bad days) and clean, 
albeit expensive.﻿

comments.text:
+Expedia Tragedies in Langley

I warn at once: I have no concept that for firefight I occurred on entrance 
to the NSA. However, as reported mass media about it, I assume that 
anything outstanding.

Other today's news from circles of the American special services is 
represented much more important, and I am sure, what you more won't read it 
anywhere.

Today, on Monday March 30, three leading personnel experts of the Ukrainian 
department of central office of CIA committed suicide.

To Langley, the State of Virginia, talk on investigation of suspicion goes 
that the Ukrainian department receives the main part of a salary not in 
CIA. Allegedly, they received the much bigger sums according to the 
pay-sheet of "one of large investment companies".

Whether because of this investigation Igor Kolomoysky so modestly behaved?

Tragedies in Langley — continuation

In headquarters of CIA to Langley, the State of Virginia, unusually 
recovered movement of personal motor transport of employees — on departure 
is observed.

The management made the decision to release all not too busy employees on 
houses to reduce number of persons who can pay attention to the mass 
investigation of suspicions in corruption which is conducted in the 
Ukrainian department.

Within two last hours two more personnel employees of the Ukrainian 
department of CIA committed suicide. Thus, the total of the staff of this 
ill-fated department who died today reached five.

Half an hour ago over two dozens staff of the Ukrainian department of CIA, 
practically all structure of department from employees in central office, 
gathered in the hall in Langley where persistently assure everyone and not 
persons interested to listen that their intentions doesn't enter to commit 
suicide, and they never even thought of it.

Nevertheless, none of these people don't seek to lose work therefore any 
didn't make the observations about a cause of death of five colleagues.
Tragedies to Langley, part III

The data shedding light on today's tragic events in Langley arrived. The 
West European politicians demanding to stop war in Ukraine in negotiations 
with the American side used careless argument: insurgents of the Southeast 
of Ukraine — not terrorists, but the citizens fighting against infringement 
of their legitimate civil rights. Similar things aren't said publicly, but 
at the closed negotiations Europeans decided to show that Americans didn't 
manage to make a fool of them.

A series of operations, which task — to show to Europe a real brutal face 
of the pro-Russian separatists was in reply developed. The plan included 
blastings child care and medical institutions of the central and western 
Ukraine, in the distance from the anti-terrorist operation zone. The task 
to strive for the maximum number of the victims was set.

It was entrusted to execute a task to saboteurs mercenaries from the 
American private military company whereas the Ukrainian department of CIA 
has to provide logistics and cover.

This plan seemed to the head of military section of the Ukrainian 
department of CIA too risky,and he shared the reasons with the chief from 
whom received the answer:

— Carry out. You don't imagine that costs on a game.

The answer of the chief didn't satisfy the subordinated. In the Ukrainian 
department, except military, there are some sections: political and so on. 
The concerned responsible in defiance of all rules shared the fears with 
equal to on a position colleagues — heads of two other sections, and in 
common they decided to take measures for prevention of implementation of 
the scandalous order, up to the appeal to the Senate of the Congress of the 
USA.

These three also appeared first "suicides", but it became clear that 
information leakage already happened. Two more were liquidated.

At the height of the working day to the employees ordered to go home, 
however practically all personnel of the Ukrainian department, being afraid 
for the lives, I gathered in the hall, in number of about 25 people. They 
urged the colleagues passing by not to trust if they allegedly commit 
suicide. 31.03.2015-This morning local time were detained 12 of the 
survived staff of the Ukrainian department. Anybody in CIA doesn't remember 
anything similar in the history of management.

Judging by a method by which misconduct were suppressed, and that murder of 
five personnel employees among whom at least three held high positions in 
central office of CIA, on all signs remains unpunished, it is possible to 
assume that the new head of National secret service on whom the president 
Obama laid hope that that will look after the unsinkable director John 
Brennan, doesn't cope with this function yet.

Within reform of management, some "werewolves" working on Vangard managed 
to be moved from some key positions — but not everyone and not from all. 
Thus behind events in the Ukrainian department we with interlocutors didn't 
manage to reveal political background.

In Vangard are adjusted to continue at any cost escalation of the conflict 
in Ukraine. Exposures which the European leaders have, and pressure upon 
administration of the White house which is successfully put by them only 
urge on aspiration of corporation to show unprecedented atrocities of 
pro-Russian "terrorists" under a false flag.

Thereby the European leaders will be driven into a corner: even if you 
don't believe that villains came from Donbass, and are convinced that this 
work of Americans — a video series on television is available, and the 
public demands to put to this disgrace an end. Arms supplies, certainly, 
will only alienate him, but in public policy of the logician doesn't work.

Efforts on lobbying were crowned with success: Vangard was succeeded to 
oppose to Obama both chambers of the Congress. As a result of a position of 
their person in Langley, the director Brennan, are far not so weakened as 
it was possible to expect.

So or who stands behind the suppressed revolt, whose interests? Draw. On 
the one hand, skilled personnel employees were afraid for "official 
authority": it is too much failures and leaks it is connected with the 
Ukrainian operation, and the risk of exposure is too great. They were 
afraid that in case of a failure them and will make whipping boys.

But also other human factors worked. One business — the enemy, the 
pro-Russian separatists, including their families and neighbors. To the 
staff of CIA not to get used to causing "the accompanying damage". 
Absolutely another — children of the Ukrainian allies and patients of the 
Ukrainian hospitals.

Matter not only in responsibility which was born by employees in case of 
exposure. Even their own children would be ostracized: your father killed 
children of other Christians.

And, at last, education. Not everyone went to serve in CIA, dreaming to 
serve corporations of military industrial complex in a budget kickback at 
any cost. Many believed that veritas vos liberabit. On the old building of 
a complex in Langley it is cut on a stone: "And Ye Shall Know the Truth and 
the Truth Shall Make You Free" — "also you learn truth, and the truth will 
make you free".

They didn't manage to get used to such truth. The gospel from Ioann doesn't 
preach to kill Christian babies — even for the sake of svekhpribyly 
dear,already rich compatriots.

They were any, but Christians, and therefore didn't manage to survive in 
Langley in our hard times. Forgive, My God, sins them.

*Ms. Baker roads to the Washing D.C. and saw a police officer ahead*
Ms. Baker: Is there a problem, officer?
FBI Agent: Ma'am, we're looking for a female terrorist. * shows a picture 
it was a black female*
Ms. Baker: Well, I'll be damned. That's the girl named Jasmine who caused 
trouble.
FBI Agent: You know her?
Ms. Baker: I sure do. This girl is plain dumb.
*Agent talks to the walkie talkie* This is post 9. I have positive ID.
Ms. Baker: And she's a retarded kid in my class.
FBI Agent: Ma'am, I'm gonna ask you to step out of vehicle.
Ms. Baker: Whoa, hold on a second, I'm here on my way to Washington D.C.
*FBI Agent points gun to Ms. Baker* Now!﻿

comments.text:
Great video by +Expedia ! I'm planning a trip to DC later this year. I've 
been there before, so I'm looking for places outside the National Mall. Any 
recommendations? #Travel  ﻿
comments.author: Fei Cai

comments.text:
+Tinika Lee : Thank you for asking! I will go there with my newborn baby, 
so I don't want to go to places that are too crowded. I'm thinking about 
the national zoo. Besides that, I really want to go to some interesting or 
traditional suburban neighborhoods, like Georgetown. But I know no place 
else. Any suggestions?
comments.author: Fei Cai
